questions.question_text: What are the possible results of port-security?

choices.C: You can verify the SDM template that is in use with the show sdm prefer command
choices.B: Changing the SDM template will not disturb switch operation.
choices.A: They are used to allocate system resources

discussion.content:
Which two statements about SDM templates are true?
A. They are used to allocate system resources
B. Changing the SDM template will not disturb switch operation
C. You can verify the SDM template that is in use with the show sdm prefer command
D. SDM templates are defined by the switch model and can’t be changed
E. SDM templates changes don’t require switch to be rebooted

Correct Answer: AC

questions.question_text: Which two statements about SDM templates are true?
Which two statements apply to LLDP?

comments.content: The question already have the statement at the begin "Wich two".

choices.C: It is not enabled by default on Cisco devices
choices.B: It runs on the network layer
choices.D: Enabled on Cisco devices by default
choices.A: It runs on the data link layer

comments.content: Once again, the question already have the statement at the begin "Wich two".

choices.B: It is the preferred switching mode in Cisco multilayer switches
choices.A: It is functionally equivalent to Cisco Express Forwarding
choices.C: It uses Loop free protocol for switching

questions.question_text: Which two statements apply to topology-based switching?
In which two ways are IEEE STP BPDUs forwarded if VLAN 99 is configured as native? (Choose two)

discussion.content:
"This list shows how PVST+ interoperates with IEEE 802.1Q or IEEE 802.1D, if the Native VLAN on an IEEE 802.1Q trunk is VLAN 1:
VLAN 1 STP BPDUs are sent to the IEEE STP MAC address (0180.c200.0000), untagged.
VLAN 1 STP BPDUs are also sent to the PVST+ MAC address, untagged.
Non-VLAN 1 STP BPDUs are sent to the PVST+ MAC address (also called the Shared Spanning Tree Protocol [SSTP] MAC address, 0100.0ccc.cccd), tagged with a corresponding IEEE 802.1Q VLAN tag.
If the Native VLAN on an IEEE 802.1Q trunk is not VLAN 1:
VLAN 1 STP BPDUs are sent to the PVST+ MAC address, tagged with a corresponding IEEE 802.1Q VLAN tag.
VLAN 1 STP BPDUs are also sent to the IEEE STP MAC address on the Native VLAN of the IEEE 802.1Q trunk, untagged.
Non-VLAN 1 STP BPDUs are sent to the PVST+ MAC address, tagged with a corresponding IEEE 802.1Q VLAN tag.
Note: Native VLAN STP BPDUs are sent untagged."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/lan-switching/spanning-tree-protocol/24063-pvid-inconsistency-24063.html#topic1

choices.A: VLAN 1 STP BPDUs are sent tagged on VLAN 1
choices.B: VLAN 1 STP BPDUs are sent tagged on VLAN 99
choices.D: VLAN 1 STP BPDUs are sent untagged on VLAN 1
choices.C: VLAN 1 and VLAN 99 BPDUs are sent tagged on VLAN 1
choices.E: VLAN 1 STP BPDUs are sent untagged on VLAN 99
